meanings.definition: A device containing gunpowder and other combustible chemicals that causes a striking display of light or noise when ignited.
meanings.sent1: The firework lit up the night sky with bright colors.
meanings.sent2: We watched a beautiful firework show on the Fourth of July.
meanings.sent3: The firework accidentally went off in the daytime, surprising everyone.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a firework, spreading joy all around.
meanings.sent5: The grand finale of the concert was a firework of music and lights.

meanings.sent1: The grand firework at the end of the celebration amazed the crowd.
meanings.sent2: The firework competition brought together talented pyrotechnicians.
meanings.sent3: The firework show was so spectacular, it felt like magic in the air.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was a firework of happiness in the room.
meanings.sent5: The firework display painted the sky with bursts of color and light.
